meanings.definition: A person who assesses or settles insurance claims.
meanings.sent1: The adjustor carefully reviewed the damage to determine the insurance payout.
meanings.sent2: The insurance adjustor arrived at the scene to evaluate the car accident.
meanings.sent3: The adjustor joked that they were like a detective, solving the mystery of the insurance claim.
meanings.sent4: She was the adjustor of emotions, always calming people down in stressful situations.
meanings.sent5: The adjustor's job was to untangle the web of information to reach a fair decision.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism for making small changes to something in order to improve its performance or accuracy.
meanings.sent1: The adjustor on the thermostat allowed him to control the room temperature.
meanings.sent2: She used a small adjustor to fine-tune the focus of the camera.
meanings.sent3: The adjustor on the telescope made stargazing even more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: His words were like an emotional adjustor, bringing comfort and clarity to the situation.
meanings.sent5: The adjustor on the clock ensured it kept perfect time throughout the day.
